text: Eurovision Choir 2021 is set to be the 3rd Eurovision Choir competition for choral singers, organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and Interkultur. == Location == === Host country selection === ==== Declined ==== * – On 19 October 2020, Interkultur announced that Belgium would not be the host country of the 2021 contest. For the first time, the contest would not be aligned as part of the European Choir Games. == Participating countries == {| class="wikitable" |+ !Country !Choir !Song(s) !Language(s) |- | |style="background:#DDF;"|TBD 2 May 2021 | | |} == International broadcasts and voting == === Commentators === {| class="wikitable" !Country !Broadcaster(s) !Commentator(s) ! |- ! colspan="4" |Participating countries |- | |S4C | | |} == Other countries == * – Swiss public broadcaster SRG SSR confirmed in September 2020 that they would not participate in the 2021 contest. == See also == * Eurovision Song Contest 2021 == References == == External links == * Category:Eurovision Choir of the Year Category:Scheduled events
title: Eurovision Choir 2021
